content: In Ireland we’re not bad at the failure bit! Generally people applaud the effort. Strangely it is the successful piece we have a problem with. A penal tax regime for entrepreneurs and a prevailing mentality that begrudges those who succeed in business mean Ireland is not the best place in the world to be a successful entrepreneur. Might explain the abundance of innovation and the absence of unicorns (with the exception of Irish run Silicon Valley HQ’d companies like Stripe and Intercom).
